page.title: 03FARM MACHINERY
page.content: Increased mechanisation has sadly led to a decrease in the labour force. 40 years ago 1 man could work app. 50 acres while now he can cope with 200 acres. Farming relies mainly on the {tractor.}The average tractor has 4 wheel drive, 100 hp, up to 20 gears and costs over Â£20,000. It is used to push and pull implements through the soil. Weeds and diseases are kept at bay by spraying a weak solution of weedkiller and fungicide through a crop sprayer on the tractor - the seed drill can also sow the fertiliser. Grain is harvested by combine harvester; turnips, potatoes or grass by smaller harvesters attached to a tractor. With the high cost of machinery farmers find it less expensive to hire specialised machinery from an Agricultural Contractor.
